intro: Gallitrichum candollei, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often surrounded by velvety, hairy leaves. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
